intro: Haplopappus lanceolatus subsp. typicus, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes many common wildflowers. Its small, wind-dispersed seeds contribute to its ability to colonize new areas.
